hints.content:
The first set of blocks shows $\blueE6$ tens and $\blueE3$ ones. 

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/51cf58079870bba2bee4b25529567c68741e3bc0)

There are $\blueE{63}$ blocks.

The second set of blocks shows $\maroonD1$ ten and $\maroonD{8}$ ones. 

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/8e3de66029055b896270448de12f602c8597a6c5)

So, we are subtracting $\maroonD{18}$ blocks.

When we subtract $\blueE{63}-\maroonD{18}$, the difference is $\blueE{45}$ blocks.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/1fb470f42f45eae6d286afd1a85e0ff25ed8d018)

This equation represents the place value blocks:

$63 - 18 = 45$

question.content:
**Which equation can be represented from the place value blocks below?**

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/ea70bb2a2d10b0688f7da059cacd2417feefa738)

[[☃ radio 1]]
